metadata.title: CVE-2022-26495 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In nbd-server in nbd before 3.24, there is an integer overflow with aresultant heap-based buffer overflow. A value of 0xffffffff in the namelength field will cause a zero-sized buffer to be allocated for the name,resulting in a write to a dangling pointer. This issue exists for theNBD_OPT_INFO, NBD_OPT_GO, and NBD_OPT_EXPORT_NAME messages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nbd-client - 1:3.23-3ubuntu1
nbd-server - 1:3.23-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nbd package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.23-3ubuntu1').
